p: No significant relationship was observed between BAI and annual temperature (R 2 = 0.0091, p > 0.05, Fig. 6), indicating that the influence of annual temperature on BAI was not as strong as that on iWUE. In addition, the relationship between BAI and precipitation were weak and not significant (R 2 = 0.0048, p > 0.05). There was a nonlinear relationship between BAI and Ca. Elevated atmospheric CO 2 concentration significantly (p < 0.01) stimulated P. orientalis biomass accumulation when Ca was less than approximately 320 ppm in the early phase; however, this effect was not pronounced when Ca exceeded 320 ppm. The correlation between BAI and iWUE was positive and significant (p < 0.01, Fig. 7).
